channel.title: Reflection Cheat client (Works for multiple servers)
channel.description:
[url=http://uppit.com/xi8kxp02udt4/Reflection.rar]Download Reflection.rar @ UppIT[/url]
#Pure jay pride
How to use it:
Step 1) Download netbeans click file, open project and navigate to reflection folder.
Step 2) Find the JAR of the web client you want to inject. (Usually in source code)
Step 3) open the .jar with zip or winrar and you'll see classes in archive
Step 4) Extract class files to reflection/classes (make sure folder is empty before you extract) (Not the build/classes the ./classes)
If this client is obfuscated you will need to rename tons of shit and classes, i've got soulsplit NR and pkhonor cheat clients but i will not release them. Its possible to dupe due to interface opening.
This works for literary any client. What this does is change variables dynamically, so we are actually using their client and changing variables to exploit the server.
Some fields might be different, such as "Client" might be named "client" just make changes to it.
You can add much more commands and send many more fake packets, go ahead server owners get obfuscating you're clients and adding more security =].
Here is the cheat client on inception:
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/5yaixz.png[/img] [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/2nc4gua.png[/img] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/2vjeuth.png[/img] [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/2qc2web.png[/img] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/kapfm.png[/img] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/zj6lna.png[/img]
I'm not teaching anyone reflection so dont pm me on how to use this. I'm sure people who know how to basic programming will understand easily.
EDIT:
Example of a fake packet command:
Spam trade the whole server:
[CODE] if(text.equals("masstrade")) { for (int i = 0; i < 400; i++) { Stream.createFrame(139); Stream.writeWordBigEndian(i); } } [/CODE]
Done this on pkhonor, froze their server mass trading everyone in game. The reason this'll work is because people don't usually have distance checks.
[IMG]http://img836.imageshack.us/img836/5029/20120707220215.png[/img] [IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/6xz3vt.png[/img] [IMG]http://img856.imageshack.us/img856/8766/20120709054516.png[/img] [IMG]http://[url=http://uppit.com/xi8kxp02udt4/Reflection.rar]Download Reflection.rar @ UppIT[/url]
How to use it:
Step 1) Download netbeans click file, open project and navigate to reflection folder.
Step 2) Find the JAR of the web client you want to inject. (Usually in source code)
Step 3) open the .jar with zip or winrar and you'll see classes in archive
Step 4) Extract class files to reflection/classes (make sure folder is empty before you extract) (Not the build/classes the ./classes)
If this client is obfuscated you will need to rename tons of shit and classes, i've got soulsplit NR and pkhonor cheat clients but i will not release them. Its possible to dupe due to interface opening.
This works for literary any client. What this does is change variables dynamically, so we are actually using their client and changing variables to exploit the server.
Some fields might be different, such as "Client" might be named "client" just make changes to it.
You can add much more commands and send many more fake packets, go ahead server owners get obfuscating you're clients and adding more security =].
Here is the cheat client on inception:
[IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/2nc4gua.png[/img] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/2vjeuth.png[/img] [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/2qc2web.png[/img] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/kapfm.png[/img] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/zj6lna.png[/img]
I'm not teaching anyone reflection so dont pm me on how to use this. I'm sure people who know how to basic programming will understand easily.
EDIT:
Example of a fake packet command:
Spam trade the whole server:
[CODE] if(text.equals("masstrade")) { for (int i = 0; i < 400; i++) { Stream.createFrame(139); Stream.writeWordBigEndian(i); } } [/CODE]
Done this on pkhonor, froze their server mass trading everyone in game. The reason this'll work is because people don't usually have distance checks.
[IMG]http://img836.imageshack.us/img836/5029/20120707220215.png[/img] [IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/6xz3vt.png[/img] [IMG]http://img856.imageshack.us/img856/8766/20120709054516.png[/img] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/s5ek9h.png[/img]

item.title: Reflection Cheat client (Works for multiple servers)
item.dc:creator: @rastanoob2 rastanoob2
item.description:
@rastanoob2 wrote:

Everything seems to run fine but the commands do not seem to work. I’m running Netbeans 7.4 with JDK 1.7.0_51
Commands do not appear in the playerpanel when i press enter either. And i get this error when i press enter:

run: Found Main is running! Found 183 methods in client and 512 fields Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0" java.lang.NullPointerException at Reflection.commands(Reflection.java:82) at PlayerPannel.actionPerformed(PlayerPannel.java:42) at javax.swing.JTextField.fireActionPerformed(JTextField.java:508) at javax.swing.JTextField.postActionEvent(JTextField.java:721) at javax.swing.JTextField$NotifyAction.actionPerformed(JTextField.java:836) at javax.swing.SwingUtilities.notifyAction(SwingUtilities.java:1662) at javax.swing.JComponent.processKeyBinding(JComponent.java:2878) at javax.swing.JComponent.processKeyBindings(JComponent.java:2925) at javax.swing.JComponent.processKeyEvent(JComponent.java:2841) at java.awt.Component.processEvent(Component.java:6282) at java.awt.Container.processEvent(Container.java:2229) at java.awt.Component.dispatchEventImpl(Component.java:4861) at java.awt.Container.dispatchEventImpl(Container.java:2287) at java.awt.Component.dispatchEvent(Component.java:4687) at java.awt.KeyboardFocusManager.redispatchEvent(KeyboardFocusManager.java:1895) at java.awt.DefaultKeyboardFocusManager.dispatchKeyEvent(DefaultKeyboardFocusManager.java:762) at java.awt.DefaultKeyboardFocusManager.preDispatchKeyEvent(DefaultKeyboardFocusManager.java:1027) at java.awt.DefaultKeyboardFocusManager.typeAheadAssertions(DefaultKeyboardFocusManager.java:899) at java.awt.DefaultKeyboardFocusManager.dispatchEvent(DefaultKeyboardFocusManager.java:727) at java.awt.Component.dispatchEventImpl(Component.java:4731) at java.awt.Container.dispatchEventImpl(Container.java:2287) at java.awt.Window.dispatchEventImpl(Window.java:2719) at java.awt.Component.dispatchEvent(Component.java:4687) at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEventImpl(EventQueue.java:735) at java.awt.EventQueue.access$200(EventQueue.java:103) at java.awt.EventQueue$3.run(EventQueue.java:694) at java.awt.EventQueue$3.run(EventQueue.java:692) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.security.ProtectionDomain$1.doIntersectionPrivilege(ProtectionDomain.java:76) at java.security.ProtectionDomain$1.doIntersectionPrivilege(ProtectionDomain.java:87) at java.awt.EventQueue$4.run(EventQueue.java:708) at java.awt.EventQueue$4.run(EventQueue.java:706) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at item.title: Reflection Cheat client (Works for multiple servers)
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:164, topic:448414”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=551310.msg4392543#msg4392543 date=1388043103]
I honestly can’t get much out of using this. It works well, but spawning bank booths and altars are about it’s limits of usefulness. It’s pretty rare in servers for noclip to be useful beyond just walking on water.

Here’s a mirror, had it lying around. Don’t think anything is edited.
http://up.ht/19ql6zH
[/quote]
Spawn a ladder anywhere. Works as an alternative to noclip.[/quote]
How is that Matzie? and JavaTC, there are tons of other uses for even the most un-experienced users.

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection Cheat client (Works for multiple servers)
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“Ired, post:154, topic:448414”][quote author=Int Bauk link=topic=551310.msg4326616#msg4326616 date=1373043765]
if you can’t run this, you shouldn’t be using it. all you need to do is download netbeans…

this is also pointless, as it only displays for the player doing the commands. not only this but most servers have these fixed… you won’t accomplish anything from using this.
[/quote]

Only the big servers are smart enough to obfuscate their clients. Add this command, of course figure out the method, but add it and spam webs so the whole server can see…

} else if (text.toLowerCase().contains("mw")) { // 3x3 webs for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) { slashWeb(i % 3 - 1, i / 3 - 1); }

Credit to Emerald Dream Source.[/quote]

even with the ‘big’ servers that are ‘smart’ enough to obfuscate their clients, the majority of the server(s) today aren’t. even with this being said, i’ve tested a variety of reflection bots on different servers; they don’t work very well, not fun, and a waste of time. most servers have most of these commands validated, except for the outdated servers that some people are using.

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection Cheat client (Works for multiple servers)
item.dc:creator: @Ired Ired
item.description:
@Ired wrote:

[quote=“natmaster200, post:151, topic:448414”]I’m terribly sorry, I’m entirely new to this. the process is, I’m trying to use this with SiriusX and so I extract the “reflection” folder from the reflection.rar archive to my desktop. And then open SiriusX.jar in Winrar. and they’re a whole bunch of different files, do I extract all the files that end in .class or just the ones there are like Class11 (for example) and what of the other folders? There is like Meta-Inf (the one in the SiriusX jar not in the reflection classes folder). In any case I tried just extracting the class files which have a specific number, (like class11) and got this error code in Netbeans:

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client
Found Main is running!
at Reflection.main(Reflection.java:29)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:366)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:355)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:354)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:424)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:308)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357)
… 1 more

Oh! Also it says that the classes folder has to be empty before I extract all those files ^? Do I delete everything first…? e_e[/quote]

If you have an error starting the client up, it either means it’s Obfuscated or something is wrong with your main class.

Read full topic

@natmaster200 wrote:

I’m terribly sorry, I’m entirely new to this. the process is, I’m trying to use this with SiriusX and so I extract the “reflection” folder from the reflection.rar archive to my desktop. And then open SiriusX.jar in Winrar. and they’re a whole bunch of different files, do I extract all the files that end in .class or just the ones there are like Class11 (for example) and what of the other folders? There is like Meta-Inf (the one in the SiriusX jar not in the reflection classes folder). In any case I tried just extracting the class files which have a specific number, (like class11) and got this error code in Netbeans:

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client
Found Main is running!
at Reflection.main(Reflection.java:29)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:366)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:355)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:354)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:424)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:308)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357)
… 1 more

Oh! Also it says that the classes folder has to be empty before I extract all those files ^? Do I delete everything first…? e_e
